INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract The aim of this paper is the development of a comparative analysis between some performance parameters and some cost allocation methods, both well described in the literature. These parameters and criteria are based on the First and Second Laws of Thermodynamics - in the case of performance parameters - and on economic concepts as well as on energetic and exergetic concepts - in the case of cost allocation methods. The study is applied to steam turbine cogeneration systems, assuming a typical worldwide sugar-cane mill. In these systems, the products are electric power, mechanic power and steam to the industrial process.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Aplicaчуo da Relaчуo entre Exergia e Entalpia na Determinaчуo de Custos Exergщticos.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: Instituto Superior Politщcnico J. A. Echeverria - ISPJAE

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo A relaчуo entre exergia e entalpia do fluido de trabalho foi aplicada р alocaчуo de custos de produчуo de vapor para aquecimento e potъncia, no тmbito do estudo termodinтmico e termoeconєmico de um sistema de cogeraчуo equipado com turbinas de contrapressуo. O conceito de exergia vem sendo bastante utilizado na anсlise termodinтmica e termoeconєmica de sistemas tщrmicos. O interesse despertado pelo mщtodo baseia-se no reconhecimento crescente da importтncia da aplicaчуo da Segunda Lei da Termodinтmica para um conhecimento mais aprofundado de sistemas e processos energщticos complexos. O desenvolvimento da sensibilidade social e cientэfica em relaчуo р conservaчуo e ao uso racional dos recursos naturais, bem como a relevтncia das questѕes ambientais, tambщm tem contribuэdo para a utilizaчуo da metodologia. Este trabalho consiste na aplicaчуo da relaчуo entre a exergia fэsica e a entalpia na determinaчуo de custos termoeconєmicos. O uso dessa relaчуo щ interessante, pois proporciona uma indicaчуo direta do comportamento de cada fluxo quanto р fraчуo de sua entalpia que corresponde р sua exergia. A aplicaчуo refere-se р alocaчуo de custos em sistemas de cogeraчуo, considerando os custos de produчуo de seus produtos principais: potъncia e calor. Os resultados sуo comparados aos obtidos por meio da abordagem usual. A anсlise aqui apresentada foi feita tomando-se como referъncia uma configuraчуo de sistema de cogeraчуo, equipada com turbinas a vapor de contra-pressуo, e muito comum nas usinas de aчњcar e сlcool existentes no Brasil.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo Щ apresentada uma avaliaчуo econєmica de sistemas de cogeraчуo em usinas de aчњcar, baseada na anсlise termodinтmica e de desempenho de trъs variantes, visando a produчуo de excedentes de eletricidade para comercializaчуo. A anсlise econєmica foi feita por meio da comparaчуo dos investimentos diferenciais em relaчуo a uma configuraчуo padrуo, e dos correspondentes diferenciais em termos de produчуo de potъncia elщtrica e de geraчуo de excedentes de bagaчo. Sуo analisadas as condiчѕes nas quais as configuraчѕes avaliadas tornam-se mais atrativas. A influъncia dos preчos do bagaчo e da energia elщtrica na atratividade destas variantes foi estudada.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract A numerical simulation on transient natural convection occurring in a square porous cavity is reported. The bottom wall of the two-dimensional cavity is heated while the upper wall is cooled, both maintained at constant temperatures. The finite volume method was applied. The applicability of the Darcy model was assumed. The transient regime is examined for several intensities of the buoyancy effects due to fluid temperature variations. The transient fluid flow and heat transfer characteristics are studied and compared to other results. Global Nusselt numbers are reported for the heated and cooled walls. Aspects of the fluid flow and temperature fields are illustrated by contour maps.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo Foi estudada a convecчуo natural em regime transitѓrio em cavidade porosa irregular. A metodologia empregada neste trabalho foi inteiramente satisfatѓria e suficiente para simulaчуo do fenєmeno fэsico considerado. Vсrios sуo os parтmetros importantes para estudar a convecчуo natural em regime transitѓrio no interior de uma cavidade porosa, mas o uso de um intervalo de tempo adequado щ fundamental para documentar a faixa onde ocorrem as maiores variaчѕes associadas ao processo. Os resultados de Caltagirone indicaram oscilaчуo do valor de Nusselt para Rayleigh acima de 300, em cavidades de seчуo quadrada. No presente trabalho foi possэvel obter convergъncia em todos os casos, sendo que o regime transitѓrio tende a um regime permanente estсvel, unicelular. Os regimes permanentes adotados como condiчѕes iniciais foram gerados a partir de distribuiчѕes nulas dos campos de funчуo corrente e de temperatura e foi possэvel constatar a formaчуo de apenas uma cщlula partindo do regime per-manente obtido para o valor imediatamente inferior de Rayleigh, em todos os casos.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: HAT Cycle Exergetic Analysis and Thermoeconomic Evaluation of Fuel Costs.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: AMERICAN SOCIETY OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERS - ASME

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Edited by M.L. Ramaningam et al. (Engineering Index)
Abstract The need of advanced and high performance power cycles is becoming an ever increasing social demand, to reduce environmental impacts and to get a better use of natural resources in power generation. The HAT cycle is one of these advanced cycles being considered for use in the next years. This cycle is gas-turbine based, comprises a recuperator and uses water to recover low temperature energy from compressor intercooler, aftercooler and from exhaust gases. However, this cycle requires high-quality (de-mineralized) water consumption. Then, some concerns about water use and costs are being discussed. This work presents an exergetic analysis of the HAT cycle, for different total pressure-ratio on compressor train. The effect of pressure ratio over the water use is also shown. The turbine inlet temperature was kept fixed, to simulate the same technological level on blade cooling and metal alloys. All sub-systems are analyzed from irreversibility viewpoint. An exergy-based thermoeconomic evaluation is made, regarding only fuel and water costs and their impacts on power cost. This methodology can highlight not only the final electric power cost (that could be achieved by conventional economic analysis), but also the internal costs of each stream and sub-system of the plant. The complete exergoeconomic analysis of the HAT cycle will depend on reliable economic data, as investment costs of each sub-system, operation and maintenance costs and the operational profile of the plant (base or peak load, yearly operation hours), as well as financial conditions.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
(Engineering Index)
Abstract The exergy method of thermodynamic analysis is used to evaluate the efficiency of proposed Biomass Integrated-Gasifier/Gas Turbine (BIG/GT) power cycles, which are being considered for application in Brazilian industries and public utilities. The performance of systems utilizing a GE LM2500 gas turbine integrated with pressurized or nearly-atmospheric pressure fluidized-bed gasifiers is studied from the exergetic viewpoint. A thermoeconomic evaluation is made for both configurations, based on recently published preliminary capital cost estimates.

Foram elaboradas subrotinas para o cсlculo de propriedades termodinтmicas da сgua e de gases, e para a modelagem de componentes. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract This paper presents a thermodynamic relation, defined to improve methodologies in Second Law Analysis of thermal systems. This relation is defined dividing the specific thermo-mechanical exergy by the specific enthalpy of a substance, adopting as reference a selected thermodynamic state. This relation is determined and analyzed for liquid water and steam in a range of temperatures (30АC - 700АC) and pressures (0.101325 MPa - 18.1 MPa). The behavior of the proposed relation is compared against the exergy behavior as function of temperature and pressure. The proposed relation can be used to compare and evaluate thermodynamic states that have similar exergy content. It makes possible to identify the states presenting higher exergetic level per enthalpy unit. This concept can be useful in thermodynamic analysis and optimization of steam cycles and thermal processes.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract The exergy method of thermodynamic analysis is used to evaluate the eficiency of proposed BIG/GT power cycles - Biomass Integrated Gasifier/Gas Turbine -, which are being considered for application in Brazilian industries and public utilities. The performance of systems utilizing a GE LM2500 gas turbine integrated with pressurized or nearly-atmospheric pressure fluidized bed gasifiers is studied from the exergetic viewpoint. A thermodynamic evaluation is made for both configurations, based on recently published preliminary capital cost estimates.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract This paper reports a numerical simulation on natural convection occurring in an irregular porous cavity. Three combinations of thermal boundary conditions are considered, involving conditions of adiabatic wall and/or isothermal heating. The horizontal upper wall is isothermally cooled and the other walls are considered as adiabatic. The steady state regime is examined for several intensities of the buoyancy effects due to temperature variations. The effects of thermal boundary conditions on the flow pattern and temperature distributions are studied. Global and local Nusselt numbers are reported for the cooled and heated walls. Contour maps illustrate aspects of the fluid flow and temperature fields.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract This paper presents the main aspects of a specialized optimal control methodology applied to the operation planning of thermal storage systems, with the objective of minimizing the energy consumption in pre-defined utilization schedules. Mathematical formulation of the thermal problem and the proposed analysis methodology are detailed for the determination of the best instants to begin the operation of heating elements. The described methodology is applied to the thermal efficiency study of four types of thermal storage systems. In all alternatives it was assumed the same utilization of heated fluid and it was defined the optimal operation procedure for each system.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo Em funчуo da grande abrangъncia e da elevada complexidade dos problemas estudados no тmbito do "Planejamento Energщtico" procura-se estimular a reflexуo metodolѓgica a respeito de procedimentos de anсlise que podem auxiliar os pesquisadores em suas atividades. Щ necessсrio observar que qualquer atividade relacionada a planejamento envolve necessariamente a definiчуo clara de um universo conceitual, de um sujeito institucional dotado de finalidades, e de hipѓteses concernentes aos meios disponэveis e рs condiчѕes que podem se verificar ao longo do perэodo considerado. A definiчуo dos objetos de estudo e de anсlise tem de levar em conta, alщm de suas caracterэsticas internas, as relaчѕes que os mesmos estabelecem com tudo que lhes щ externo, e que ao mesmo tempo lhes dс sentido. O processo histѓrico em que todas as entidades se desenvolvem deve ser considerado em toda sua plenitude, visando captar as possibilidades e tendъncias da realidade. A consideraчуo das categorias de totalidade e de historicidade pode permitir que se compreendam mais profundamente as caracterэsticas desses objetos de anсlise.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Edited by H. Metghalchi et al. (Engineering Index)
Abstract A thermodynamic relation, defined to improve methodologies in Second Law Analysis of thermal systems, is studied. This relation is defined dividing the specific thermo-mechanical exergy by the specific enthalpy of a substance, adopting as reference a selected thermodynamic state. This relation is determined and analyzed for liquid water and steam in a range of temperatures (30АC - 700АC) and pressures (0.101325 MPa - 18.1 MPa). The behavior of the proposed relation is compared against the exergy behavior as a function of temperature and pressure. The proposed relation can be used to compare and evaluate thermodynamic states that have similar exergy content. It makes possible to identify the states presenting higher exergetic level per enthalpy unit. The variation of partial derivatives (temperature and presssure) of the specific thermo-mechanical exergy for superheated steam is analysed. The variation of partial derivatives of the themodynamic relation between the exergy and enthalpy (adopting as reference a selected thermodynamic state) is also studied. Those derivatives are determined for subcooled liquid water and superheated steam in a range of temperatures (200АC - 700АC) and pressures (2 MPa - 18MPa). The behavior of the partial derivatives is compared and discussed against the variation of enthalpy and entropy, considering the effects of temperature and pressure variations. The analysis performed in this work can help to improve methodologies in Second Law Analysis of thermal systems. The aspects focused can be useful in thermodynamic analysis and optimization of steam cycles and thermal processes.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Edited by H. Metgalchi et al. (Engineering Index)
Abstract Biomass gasification and the sequential use of the produced gas in gas turbines (the so called Biomass Integrated Gasifier - Gas Turbine cycles) is one of the technologies that can minimize carbon dioxide emissions on electricity generation. As the primer mover of such power plants, gas turbine performance is a key parameter on the economics of BIG-GT systems. At least within the first generation of this technology, gas turbines originally designed for burning conventional fuels (natural gas and light oils) will be adapted to syngas burning. At this stage some changes on combustion chamber will be required, and some modifications on operational control parameters must be done as well. Gas turbine de-rating (reduction of gas turbine firing temperature) is the simplest control alternative to avoid problems concerned with reduction of compressor surge margin and increased thermal loads. However, from the performance view point of the gas turbine (and also for the whole system), this seems to be the worst option. In this paper the de-rating alternative is analyzed both from a thermodynamic and an economic point of view. A BIG-CC system based on a nearly atmospheric air-blown gasifier is considered. De-rating is analyzed vis-р-vis moderate increases of compressor pressure ratio. A simulation code (developed by the authors) able to perform analysis of thermal power systems (and particularly BIG-GT systems) is applied on this study. Cost functions are used to estimate the total installed unit capital cost, allowing a proper evaluation of electricity generating costs. The results indicate that electricity costs are sensitive to de-rating either due to the reduction on electricity generating efficiency and to the increase on the unit capital cost.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Edited by R. A. Nelson, Jr. and D. Kaminski (Engineering Index) Abstract Combined natural and forced convection occurring in saturated porous media is an important subject in several engineering fields, including design of high performance thermal insulation systems, packed beds, contaminants flow, and the development of geothermal resources. The paper presents numerical simulation results on mixed convection flow past a porous cavity located in a porous layer. The steady-state regime is studied for several intensities of the buoyancy effects due to temperature variations. The influences of Pщclet and Rayleigh numbers on flow pattern and temperature distributions are examined. Local and global Nusselt numbers are reported for the heated wall. The differential equations were approximated numerically, being discretized by integration over finite volumes. The fluxes at the volume boundaries were represented using the UNIFAES discretization scheme. The UNIFAES, unified finite approaches exponential scheme for convective-diffusive fluid transport equations, has shown excellent accuracy and stability with irregular grids.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract A computational program was developed for the analysis of gas turbine cycles. A structured methodology of calculation for the efficiency and the specific work of gas turbines is presented. The program includes several gas turbine cycles, being enough to choose the cycle type and to introduce the data to obtain the numeric results, presenting didactic interest. There are obtained coherent results, similar to the data found in the literature. The program will be available by Internet in the Thermodynamics page of Mechanical Engineering course of Unicamp.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract This paper deals with two-dimensional simulation of natural convection within a square porous cavity heated from bellow. Only single-cell solutions of this porous Bщnard-like convection problem are considered. Two discretization schemes are employed for comparison purposes: the Power-law scheme, that approaches the simple exponential scheme, and a new discretization scheme, UNIFAES, modified according to the same approximation rule of the Power-law. Results indicate the superior accuracy of UNIFAES as the Rayleigh number increases.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract Combined natural and forced convection occurring in saturated porous media is an important subject in several engineering fields, including design of high performance thermal insulation systems, packed beds, exploration of petroleum and gas fields, and the development of geothermal resources. The paper presents numerical simulation results on mixed convection in a two dimensional porous layer, with a depression in the bottom surface, heated from below. The steady-state regime is studied for several intensities of the buoyancy effects due to temperature variations.. Local and global Nusselt numbers are reported for the cooled and heated walls. The differential equations were approximated numerically, using a computer code previously developed. The equations were discretized by integration over finite volumes. The convective-diffusive fluxes at the volume boundaries were represented using the UNIFAES,, unified finite approaches exponential scheme for convective-diffusive fluid transport equations, which has been showing excellent accuracy and stability. We present in this paper a comparison between results obtained with the present scheme and the power law scheme using different degrees of grid refinement.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract Natural convection occurring in saturated porous media is an important subject in several engineering fields, including the design of high performance thermal insulation systems, packed beds, exploration of petroleum and gas fields, and the development of geothermal resources. The paper presents numerical simulation results on transient natural convection in a square bi-dimensional porous cavity. The differential equations were approximated numerically by integration over finite volumes. The fluxes at the volume boundaries were represented using the power-law discretization scheme. The Darcy model for fluid flow in porous media was utilized. The transient regime was studied for several intensities of the buoyancy effects due to temperature gradients. The time evolution of global Nusselt number is reported for the cooled and heated walls. The variation of flow intensity is also analyzed. The oscillations observed during the transient process are reported and contour maps for stream lines and constant temperature lines are presented.

(Engineering Index)
Abstract Sуo Paulo is the Brazilian state with the largest economic production, the largest population and the largest industrial park of the country, with a participation in GDP of 36.6% (population: 34 million, area: 248,600 kmВ, urbane population: 92,8%, illiteracy: 10%, infantile mortality: 26.2/1000). Great part of the industry from Sуo Paulo concentrates on the metropolitan area of Sуo Paulo, but in the interior, several cities are becoming important in many industrial sectors. After 1930 Sуo Paulo became the vanguard of the industrialization and of the Brazilian modernization. Together with the agricultural expansion (coffee, sugar-cane, soy, corn, bean, wheat, banana, orange), the state had an extraordinary industrial development. The transformation industry (steel, cement, machines and components, etc.) and, mainly, the industries of consumption goods (woven, medicines, hygiene and cleaning) and durable goods (automobiles and appliances) developed intensively. Channeling the great flows of investments of the American and European multinationals and the great internal migratory currents, Sуo Paulo increased its population vastly, it diversified its social structure and it consolidated its economic force. The wealth and the poverty, however, still live together side by side. To some extent the economic growth of the state has been smaller in the last three decades, with many investors looking for more profitable opportunities in another areas of the country, partly because the available urban and industrial infrastructure is out, being insufficient to assist to the social demands of transport, health, dwelling and education. With that, Sуo Paulo shows off today, beside the wealth of vast areas of the interior, the impoverishment of its metropolitan area. The State of Sуo Paulo, in 1995, consumed 82.9 TWh of electrical energy, being the consumption of the industrial sector of 39.6 TWh. On that same year Brazil consumed a total of 249.9

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract Numerical simulation results on the comparison of natural convection in air filled cavities and in porous cavities are presented. The same geometrical configuration and boundary conditions are considered for both cases. The steady-state regime is studied for several intensities of the buoyancy effects due to temperature variations. The effects of geometric aspects on flow pattern and temperature distributions are examined. Global Nusselt numbers and stream-function maximum values are reported for both cases.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. This work reports a numerical simulation on steady regime natural convection occurring in a horizontal porous layer. The bottom wall of the layer is heated while the upper wall is cooled, both at constant temperatures. The steady regime is examined for several intensities of the buoyancy effects due to temperature gradients. The fluid flow and heat transfer characteristics are studied. Global Nusselt numbers are reported for the heated and cooled walls. Aspects of the fluid flow and temperature fields are illustrated by contour maps.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Produtos e Serviчos Voltados Para A Defesa e Proteчуo do Meio Ambiente, Incluindo O Desenvolvimento Sustentado

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo. A geraчуo de entropia em convecчуo natural no interior de cavidade porosa saturada bidimensional, aquecida atravщs de sua parede inferior e resfriada por meio de sua parede superior, foi avaliada em situaчѕes para as quais foi verificada multiplicidade de soluчѕes em regime permanente. Щ apresentada a formulaчуo adimensional do balanчo de entropia para o problema estudado, visando o cсlculo da geraчуo de entropia associada р transferъncia de calor e ao escoamento do fluido. Sуo apresentados os resultados obtidos para a geraчуo de entropia nos diversos casos estudados, considerando a dissipaчуo associada р transferъncia de calor e ao escoamento do fluido. A distribuiчуo da geraчуo de entropia щ ilustrada por meio de mapas de linhas de valores constantes. As conclusѕes do trabalho incluem a verificaчуo de que, nos casos estudados, a geraчуo de entropia associada р transferъncia de calor щ muito mais importante do que a associada ao escoamento. Palavras-chave: Geraчуo de entropia, Convecчуo natural, Cavidade porosa

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract Co-fired combined cycles have being studied as alternatives for power production. Biomass-derived fuels would be mixed with natural gas to be burned in gas turbines. In this paper, the effect of the off-design operation of HRSG is investigated. Off-design conditions correspond to burn different fuel compositions in the gas turbine. The reference case corresponds to a combined cycle of about 220 MW - ISO basis, designed for natural gas. Two design alternatives of HRSGs were considered and analyzed from the point of view of thermal performance. It is found that the best option is the design that corresponds to a stand-alone BIG-CC unit. The flexibility of a combined cycle regarding the fuel mix is problematic and further studies are required.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Produtos e Serviчos Voltados Para A Defesa e Proteчуo do Meio Ambiente, Incluindo O Desenvolvimento Sustentado

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. This article describes the UNIFAES, Unified Finite Approach Exponential-type Scheme for convective-diffusive fluid transport equations, including the treatment of Neumann boundary conditions. To reduce the computing time, UNIFAES allows the use of Patankar's power-law approximation rule. The scheme is subjected to the Smith and Hutton test problem, where it is compared to central differencing, the exponential scheme, and the locally analytic differencing scheme (LOADS). Finally, the scheme is applied to the problem of natural convection within a square porous cavity heated from below, considering single-cell and multiple-cell solutions of this porous Bщnard-like convection problem.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Application of the UNIFAES Discretization Scheme to Mixed Convection in a Porous Layer with a Cavity, Using Darcy Model

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Produtos e Serviчos Voltados Para A Defesa e Proteчуo do Meio Ambiente, Incluindo O Desenvolvimento Sustentado

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT Results of numerical simulations are presented on mixed convection in a two dimensional, horizontal, saturated porous layer, with a cavity of varying depth on the bottom surface, heated from below. The problem formulation was based on the Darcy model to relate the velocity and the pressure fields, and on the Boussinesq hypothesis for the buoyancy effects. The convective-diffusive fluxes at the volume boundaries were represented using the UNIFAES, Unified Finite Approach Exponential-type Scheme, with the Power-Law approximation to reduce the computing time. The conditions established by Rivas (1972) for the order of accuracy of the differencing schemes to be maintained in irregular grids allowed reliable accuracy estimates to be obtained. The steady state regime was studied for Pщclet numbers 1, 10, and 100, Rayleigh numbers between 1 and 2000, and cavity aspect ratios 0, 0.5, 1, and 2. Tabulated results for average Nusselt number and maximum and minimum stream function values are reported for the cases simulated. Maps of streamlines and isothermal lines are presented. For deep cavities, multiple steady solutions are reported.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Numerical Study on Mixed Convection in a Horizontal Flow Past a Square Porous Cavity Using UNIFAES Scheme

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Produtos e Serviчos Voltados Para A Defesa e Proteчуo do Meio Ambiente, Incluindo O Desenvolvimento Sustentado

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract Mixed convection on the flow past a heated length and past a porous cavity located in a horizontal wall bounding a saturated porous medium is numerically simulated. The cavity is heated from below. The steady-state regime is studied for several intensities of the buoyancy effects due to temperature variations. The influences of Pщclet and Rayleigh numbers on the flow pattern and the temperature distributions are examined. Local and global Nusselt numbers are reported for the heated surface. The convective-diffusive fluxes at the volume boundaries are represented using the UNIFAES, Unified Finite Approach Exponential-type Scheme, with the Power-Law approximation to reduce the computing time. The conditions established by Rivas for the quadratic order of accuracy of the central differencing to be maintained in irregular grids are shown to be extensible to other quadratic schemes, including UNIFAES, so that accuracy estimates could be obtained.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Evaluaciѓn de Alternativas de Cogeneraciѓn en Centrales Azucareros Cubanos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract Three different cogeneration systems were analyzed, with several configurations for sugar cane plants, aiming to produce an excess of electric power for commercialization. The influence of the steam generation parameters (pressure and temperature), the steam generators efficiency and the dependence of the electricity generation on the process steam demand were analyzed for the configurations of best performance. An exergy analysis and an economical evaluation were done for the cases with the best results.
